answers.question: Is your project a member or past grantee of one of these networks?

answers.answer:
Create and develop collaborative spaces for digital & agroecological capacity-building to Increase Awareness, Engagement, Adoption, and Development of ReFi Web3
Create & Catalyse Local Ecological, Social, and Economic Impact by Bimonthly Web 3 webinars for community onboarding (web 3 on/off ramping in Costa Rica), Bloom Network, Common Approach.
Increase public awareness of how blockchain can support intersectional (ecological and social) regeneration in a friendly way by organizing Crypto Monthly Crypto Events in San Jose and Tamarindo in collaboration with local partners to catalyse community action.
Community education guide creation for Web 3 Ambassador Program for Regenerative organizations impact reporting Karma Gap, Gitcoin fundraising, DAO formation, in English & EspaÃ±ol thought for vocational education and bioregional capacity building.
Covering tax and legal fees associated with the project if any.

We propose the meme "Sayariki", as a bioregional regeneration movement in Costa Rica that leverages web3 tools.

This initiative merges web3 engagement, regenerative culture, and pop-art storytelling (inspired by Dragon Ballâ€™s Goku) to drive measurable impact in Costa Ricaâ€™s ecosystems and communities.
answers.question: What are your key active goals, plans, objectives or milestones for this year?

project.title: Refi Costa Rica
project.description:
Proposal for RegenCoordination Funding Round: ReFi Costa Rica 
"Sayariki Regeneration Movement"

Project Goals
Create and develop collaborative spaces for digital & agroecological capacity-building to Increase Awareness, Engagement, Adoption, and Development of ReFi Web3
Create & Catalyse Local Ecological, Social, and Economic Impact by Bimonthly Web 3 webinars for community onboarding (web 3 on/off ramping in Costa Rica), Bloom Network, Common Approach.
Increase public awareness of how blockchain can support intersectional (ecological and social) regeneration in a friendly way by organizing Crypto Cantinas Events in San Jose and Tamarindo in collaboration with local partners to catalyse community action.
Community education guide creation for Web 3 Ambassador Program for Regenerative organizations impact reporting Karma Gap, Gitcoin fundraising, DAO formation, in English & EspaÃ±ol thought for vocational education and bioregional capacity building.
Covering tax and legal fees associated with the project if any.

We propose the meme "Sayariki", as a bioregional regeneration movement in Costa Rica that leverages web3 tools.

This initiative merges web3 engagement, regenerative culture, and pop-art storytelling (inspired by Dragon Ballâ€™s Goku) to drive measurable impact in Costa Ricaâ€™s ecosystems and communities.

Long Term
Expanding our operations team to tackle larger-scale projects.
White Labelling products to solve identified needs of the demand such as community education guide to use quadratic funding, market directories, biodiversity credits, community asset vouchers, community attestation & crypto in English & EspaÃ±ol.
Increasing partnership and distribution efforts to share knowledge and increase action towards ecological restoration and regenerative action.
The expansion and capacity building of dMRV methodologies co-development of regenerative cattle grazing methodologies for pilots in Costa Rica with Costaricaregenerativa.org and suelosvivos.org to make a took kit for bioregional regeneration leveraging GIS, biodiversity credits, Fundraising and community asset vouchers.


2. Problem & Opportunity
Problem:
Lack of public funding and engagement in Costa Rica with web3â€™s potential for ecological regeneration.
The power of Web3 has yet to be fully realised in climate action as many of these technologies remain disconnected from communities on-the-ground. Access to funding, expertise, and technology is a major challenge - particularly in the Global Southâ€™s rural and indigenous communities who have massive potential to expand biodiversity protection and commons stewardship, but lack management, operations, resources, market access and funding to grow initiatives.
Discoordination efforts in the intersection of agroecology and digital collaboration, with few incentives in the country for coordinated collective action.
Need for cultural narratives that inspire regeneration (current media lacks compelling regenerative heroes).
Opportunity:
Costa Rica is a global leader in conservation & sustainability, making it ideal for a web3-powered regeneration movement.
Web3 tools (NFTs, DAOs, quadratic funding) can incentivize and track regenerative actions.
"Sayariki" (Goku as a regenerative hero) provides a fun, culturally resonant way to engage communities.

3. Solution: The Sayariki Movement
A. Awareness & Engagement (Web3 for Bioregional Regeneration)
Workshops & Hackathons:
Teach web3 tools for regenerative projects (e.g., Gitcoin-style funding, regenerative NFTs, the actuality of money). Also involving local actors with vocational inclination for web 3, to onboard local stakeholders.
Partner with local universities & agroecology orgs (University for International Cooperation -https://uci.ac.cr/es/home-, Earth University -https://www.earth.ac.cr/-, CATIE -https://www.catie.ac.cr/en/-).
Social Media Campaign:
Short videos of "Sayariki" (Goku) explaining how web3 helps regeneration.
Meme contests for best regenerative actions.
Ecosystem Development
Mycelium connection with identified impact local actors such as:
monteverde-institute.org
https://www.avercr.org/
https://www.higueronescoop.org/es
https://biosur.org/ 
 And the worldwide ReFi ecosystem and Land Nodes
Muda-oe.com
ReFi Brasil 
ReFi Colombia
B. Collaborative Web3 Spaces (Capacity Building)
Integrated Dojo:
A digital learning hub where users:
Learn about web3 technologies, applications, and concepts
Meet, exchange with, and build community 
Engage with weekly or biweekly frequency
Execution driven physical learning hubs where users:
Engage in "Minga" (community work) documentation (upload photos/videos of tree planting, cleanups, etc.). Can hire/solicit extra support via associated partners.
Access agroecology courses (soil health, syntropic farming, biomimicry).
Regenerative Bounties:
Small grants (CELO/ETH/ecoins) for completing regenerative tasks (e.g., "Plant 100 native trees, get 50 DAI").

C. Test The "Henkidama" Art Project viability
Interactive Website:
Users submit proof of regenerative actions (e.g., "Minga" documentation).
Each submission charges the "henkidama" (visualized as growing on the site).
Finale: "Spirit Bomb Release" (Prize Distribution)
After 3 months, the "henkidama" is released as:
Prize pool (in crypto) for top contributors.
Poap badges for participants.

4. Expected Impact (Aligned with Gitcoin Criteria)
Criteria
Our Impact
Increase Awareness, Engagement, Adoption of ReFi Web3 (1-5)
5/5 â€“ Workshops, memes, and the "henkidama" project will drive engagement.
Boost Activity on Celo/Ethereum (1-5)
4/5 â€“ Uses Celo for micropayments, Ethereum for NFTs/SBTs.
Local Ecological/Social Impact (1-5)
5/5 â€“ Directly funds regenerative actions (tree planting, soil restoration).
Additional Outcomes (1-10)
8/10 â€“ Novel mix of pop culture, web3, and regeneration. Strong team (web3 devs + agroecologists).
Clear Milestones (1-10)
9/10 â€“ Quarterly goals with measurable KPIs.



5. Team & Partnerships
ReFi Costa Rica Coordination and Web3 Dev Team (Costa Rican DAO builders)
Core Team:
Arturo Montanaro (https://www.linkedin.com/feed/update/urn:li:activity:7310226635293614082 - https://x.com/LandiaRegen)
Randall Saborio  (https://www.linkedin.com/in/randall-sabor%C3%ADo-99446b50/ )
Esteban Solis ( https://www.linkedin.com/in/esteban-sol%C3%ADs-hidalgo )
Stefan Fiedler (https://www.linkedin.com/feed/update/urn:li:activity:7310226635293614082/)	
Ale Alvarado (https://www.linkedin.com/in/alejandro-buenridecr )
Gustavo Segovia (https://x.com/sepu85 )
Danibelle Give 
Agroecology Experts (University mentors, local organic producers, indigenous)
Digital Artists (creating Sayariki NFT art)
Integrate digital artists to the core team.
Partners: Thecleanwave.org, University for International Cooperation, Earth University, ReFi Costa Rica, Celo LATAM, Aso Blockchain Costa Rica, https://giveth.io/project/diamante-bridge-collective-0, Regen Network Foundation.


6. Why Fund Us?
âœ… Unique blend of pop culture + web3 + regenerative knowledge + already mapped big portion of the Regen Community through the different team members
âœ… Clear milestones & measurable impact
âœ… Strong local partnerships in Costa Rica and increase reach in Latin America
âœ… Fun, engaging approach to serious social, ecological, and economic regeneration

Next Steps
Weâ€™re ready to launch immediately upon funding. Letâ€™s make Costa Rica a global hub for web3-powered regeneration! ðŸŒ±ðŸ’¥

"Sayariki needs YOUR energyâ€”help us charge the henkidama!"
